633311499.name: Toddler and teen
633311499.author: a TripAdvisor user
633311499.reviewBody:
Price: 1000 pesos (around 60 dlls) for camping ⛺️ 
You need to take your food, there is a little store, but offers few items. 
For this price you get: private hot spring tub, place to park, place for  camping, table and benches, fire place and a place for bbq. 
For 200 pesos (around 11 dlls) you can get like 4 hrs of wood. 
There are clean restrooms, just one shower 🚿 a pool and a mud tub. 
You need a big ( tall) car to get there. Regular 🚙 cars won’t make it. 
No cellphone reception 
It has waterfalls 3 hrs walk away and they have water like around Feb-March. Cold water. 
It gets windy 
No music allow
My teen daughter slept early and almost all next day. My 1.9 old baby had a blast inside our private pool. 
We want to go back.

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal #2 Km. 28

473693607.name: Real desert oasis
473693607.author: a TripAdvisor user
473693607.reviewBody: A rough trip over 37 miles of dirt road is rewarded by this isolated desert oasis.  Greeted by members of the family who have owned the oasis since 1840, the campground is unique.  Each campsite features its own spring fed hot tub.  There are some amenities such as flush toilets and a little store...a very little store.  We forgot to bring plates and our hosts picked up some paper plates for us on a run to Mexicali.  I don\'t recommend forgetting anything though.  We lucked out that they had planned to drive out for supplies.  We had two very different types of experiences at the oasis.  The first few days were during the week and there were very few people, super quiet and peaceful.  The weekend had a full campground and there was a lot of people.  But really fun and friendly.  One of the highlights of our visit was an impromptu volleyball game.  Mud bath is fun.  You jump into a pool of black mud, wipe it all over you body, wait 3 minutes in the sun and then go and scrub and scrub in the shower to get it off...exfoliation magic.  The big pool is great.  The waterfall is well worth the walk. But go early to avoid the dangerous heat of the day.  Our hosts saw us leave, but didn\'t see us come back.  They came to check on us right after sundown to make sure we were safe.  Do NOT attempt to drive here without a four-wheel drive or SUV!!  My Subaru Outback did great.  It is a little expensive but worth the money.  Bring enough water!  Keep in mind that this is desert heat and you will need to be careful to stay hydrated.  We lucked out and the full desert was in bloom.  Awesome beauty. Great sunsets and sunrises. Just beautiful.  NO INTERNET OR CELL PHONE SERVICE!!!

address.streetAddress: Carretera Federal #2 Km. 28

378468689.name: Much bigger than I thought!
378468689.author: a TripAdvisor user
378468689.reviewBody: While this casino looks very small from the outside, it was very deceiving. It\'s actually quite large inside and had many different areas. While I haven\'t been to all of them, I think this is the largest casino in Mexicali that I have been to. There were also plenty of staff around to help. One thing I did notice is that their bands & clubs don\'t even start until 9PM and they also have some food specials starting at 9PM. So it seems like more of a place to late night or after hours more than anything else.

address.streetAddress: Av. Republica de Panama #15

309641076.name: NOTHING TO COMPARE WITH ANY CASINO IN VEGAS, O CALIFORNIA.
309641076.author: a TripAdvisor user
309641076.reviewBody: IS A small casino., SMALL area for bething IN SPORTS booking or horses.. lots of slots my brothers and wife like to go there SOME TIMES. VERY CLEAN BETTER THEN THE OTHERS IN MEXICALI,

address.streetAddress: Av. Republica de Panama #15

268420820.name: A NIGHT AT THE CASINO
268420820.author: a TripAdvisor user
268420820.reviewBody: Went to hear American Rock & Roll ... and take my wife out to dinner.  Dinner was Las Vegas buffet style WITHOUT the super selection of FINE foods... BUT if you play the slots you can get your dinner for FREE with slot points!

address.streetAddress: Av. Republica de Panama #15

156517780.name: Casino mexico
156517780.author: a TripAdvisor user
156517780.reviewBody: I really enjoy this casino, as the machines are usually clean and working well.  I would caution patrons to NOT have their cars cleaned in the casino parking lot as those who do this work often use dirty water and rags and scratch the vehicles badly.  My windshield was scratched so bad that I had to replace it!

address.streetAddress: Av. Republica de Panama #15

146049370.name: Amazing casino
146049370.author: a TripAdvisor user
146049370.reviewBody:
More than a casino is an entire entertainment center.
The top slots of the city, very different brands and great fun.
Besides the facilities are very elegant and classy.
The food is very good and performing activities and raffles are very original. I have not seen anything like this in Mexico.
They have the best Rewards program in the country
Excelent and very professional service

For lovers of nightlife Arenia has its own nightclub called "Classico" open Thursday, Friday and Saturday.

An incredible experience!

address.streetAddress: Av. Republica de Panama #15

129561243.name: Nice but...
129561243.author: a TripAdvisor user
129561243.reviewBody: A very nice little Casino just crowded and a little worried with parking...

address.streetAddress: Av. Republica de Panama #15

651788299.name: if you like the arts...
651788299.author: a TripAdvisor user
651788299.reviewBody: This is the State run center for the arts. If you plan to visit, they always have one or 2 exhibits by local artist. Sometimes paints, others photography. But where this place really shines is on the varied art courses and training they do, since that is it\'s primary function.\nYou can also come for a good concert, fine cinema, theater and many other things. be sure to check their website for the monthly program.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Estatal de las Artes, Mexicali

address.streetAddress: Calz de los Presidentes Zona del Río Nuevo

594864277.name: Summer concerts asnd afternoons dancing Danzon
594864277.author: a TripAdvisor user
594864277.reviewBody: The summer is for listen excellent orquestal concerts with young people. Clasdic m\u00fasica like Mozart,Engels excellent pianos boys and lovely viol\u00edn giros. Alz\u00f3 theres as good arte museum with local atist.\nBut if you want to enjoy the afternoon go to learn dasnce Danzon, this tradicional mexicano m\u00fasica has the power to make you feel un  other time. Come and visita this nice place un Mexicali

itemReviewed.name: Centro Estatal de las Artes, Mexicali

address.streetAddress: Calz de los Presidentes Zona del Río Nuevo

467089391.name: a good venue for arts
467089391.author: a TripAdvisor user
467089391.reviewBody: Been here several times, since my daughter dances ballet. There are several areas for dance presentations and music. Being the music auditorium new and impressive.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Estatal de las Artes, Mexicali

address.streetAddress: Calz de los Presidentes Zona del Río Nuevo

455385330.name: Visit while in Mexicali
455385330.author: a TripAdvisor user
455385330.reviewBody: Great place to stop while visiting! Various local artist from Mexicali tales photographers and painter. Many classes offered in the arts to the residents of Mexicali great addition to the area.

itemReviewed.name: Centro Estatal de las Artes, Mexicali

address.streetAddress: Calz de los Presidentes Zona del Río Nuevo

340836737.name: Cerro Prieto The Sleeping Volcano
340836737.author: a TripAdvisor user
340836737.reviewBody: This Place is around 40 minutes outside of Mexicali and it is like a regular small mountain , however for my surprise this is an OLD Sleeping volcano which is related to the San Andres Fault.  As you may know there are small earthquakes in Mexicali,  \n\nNo body know when this volcano will turn on, so far I was lucky enough so for the first time a sleeping volcano

556138990.name: Movie Time!!!
556138990.author: a TripAdvisor user
556138990.reviewBody: Nice shopping mall/plaza, away from the border so you get more of the local feel. We like going to the movies and walk around. There is a food court, Starbucks, an arcade for the kids a Casino for the adults and all the normal businesses you find at a mall including a Walmart.

address.streetAddress: Blvd. Lazaro Cardenas and Calle 11 El Porvenir

635225712.name: perfect place for children and family time
635225712.author: a TripAdvisor user
635225712.reviewBody: this is a great place where children can learn, touch and play at the same time. They also have an Imax movie theatre which makes the movie experience even greater. If you visit Mexicali, and have children, visitng Museo Sol del ni\u00f1o is a must.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

631421977.name: A good place to have fun and learn
631421977.author: a TripAdvisor user
631421977.reviewBody: Its one or the only places in Mexicali with kids developmental and learning interactive museum, air conditioning in summer, imax theatre, cafeteria with snacks, drinks and coffee!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

513385870.name: Perfect for learning
513385870.author: a TripAdvisor user
513385870.reviewBody: I like to take my nephew here because they have different games for all ages, all of their games are very dynamic and if you go in groups they also have guides that explain everything. What I love is that they have a 3D cinema with all types of foods and drinks inside the museum. I will definitely be going soon.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

513007841.name: nice sunday
513007841.author: a TripAdvisor user
513007841.reviewBody: nice place, great for kids of all ages, they have a cinema with enterteining and educational movies, snack bar and a big green area for kids to play, plenty of parking space.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

448088844.name: excellent family outing
448088844.author: a TripAdvisor user
448088844.reviewBody: this is a good place for teens and kids, lots of activities and they;re all included with ticket, except for the imax. lots of guides to explain the exhibits and there is not a wait for most activities.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

445616723.name: Very good place for alll ages
445616723.author: a TripAdvisor user
445616723.reviewBody: This a very good place for all ages, is smaller than papalote museo del ni\u00f1o en Ciudad de Mexico but is an excelet place to pass time with your famili special little kids, they will love all the stuf that are in the place, also have movie theater in 3D, I just can say is a good place.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

435910698.name: Remarkable place for families
435910698.author: a TripAdvisor user
435910698.reviewBody: It\'s nice to have this kind of places in Mexicali, especially when weather strikes hard during summer. It\'s an excellent place to spend a few hours playing and learning at the same time. Also you can watch a movie at the Dome. snacks and souvenirs store are available!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

427384270.name: Excellent place to have some fun.
427384270.author: a TripAdvisor user
427384270.reviewBody: This is an excellent place to have some fun and learning. Your children will love it and you will be happy on their excitement.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

400537457.name: Fun
400537457.author: a TripAdvisor user
400537457.reviewBody: A place where you can have fun and also learn. The museum has different exhibition and they are interactive, it has a rock climbing, a playground, an IMAX theater. \nThe museum is open Tue - Sun from 10 am - 6 pm, the price is $60 pesos ($3.33 USD) and the combo museum + Imax $110 pesos ($6 USD)

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

379448876.name: Wholesome family fun!
379448876.author: a TripAdvisor user
379448876.reviewBody: This is a place where you and your family can mix fun with science, the exhibitions are entertaining and formative science wise, it\'s like agiant lab where everyone can play, the this building it self is an interesting historical piece of the region, it\'s an old industrial cotton mill that dates from the early 20th century. It\'s an interactive center dedicated to science, technology, art and enviroment awareness, plus, yes there is a plus, contrastin with the vintage industrial building it shares a lobby with an ultramodern structure that houses the only IMAX theater in the region which features HD 3D movies all year long.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

364276947.name: Super fun and amazing for whole family love this!
364276947.author: a TripAdvisor user
364276947.reviewBody: Amazing!  A must see.I took my husband and 5 year old son. We had a blast.The museum was the best we had ever seen. The park was huge, so many playgrounds and we all rode the adult sized teeter totter felt like a kid again. Super huge interactive, and super fun!!!

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

361280346.name: Excellent Interactive Center for Kids and Family!
361280346.author: a TripAdvisor user
361280346.reviewBody: We took our boys ages 5 and 8 years old and they loved it! Not only was it fun, but it was also educational. The museum has attendants at several of the hands-on exhibits to either explain or assist. I didn\'t rate it 5 stars because there were a few exhibits that were out of service. Highlights were the gyrosphere, rock climbing, and IMAX theater! There is also an arts & crafts area. The museum is clean both inside and out. The landscape is well kept and there were plenty of seating areas. The kids also enjoyed the outdoor playground Oh, and they have birthday party packages if you would like to host a party. Admission for only the museum only was $3.65 per person ($60 pesos) or $6.69 per person ($110 pesos) if you get the museum and IMAX package deal. They\'re open Tuesday-Sunday (CLOSED ON MONDAY\'S) from 10AM to 6PM.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

346009093.name: UNREAL!
346009093.author: a TripAdvisor user
346009093.reviewBody: Loads to do... and a lot is inter-active... and there is an IMAX theater! Great for families, children or adults... located in a beautiful park with ample picnic areas and activities for children.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

300115029.name: Entertaining
300115029.author: a TripAdvisor user
300115029.reviewBody: A good place to visit with kids and teens, even adults can have some fun. \nThere\'s a lot of things to do like rock climbing and natural related areas.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

292707101.name: Museo sol del ni\u00f1o
292707101.author: a TripAdvisor user
292707101.reviewBody: The first time in Mexicali my wife and I did not know what there was to do in Mexicali, so we drove around until we found a zoo, a plaza and  Museo sol del ni\u00f1o. Here we had a lot of fun, it\'s an interactive museum for children and adults. First there\'s 2 sections to the museum, There\'s a sphere that you can get on and goes around as your strap from your hands and legs, there\'s also a rock climbing, a place to make bubbles  and others things to do there. They also have a imax theater. overall great time there. been here 3 times, fun place for the family.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Comandante Alfonso Esquer S/N Centro

601974929.name: Beautiful church!!!
601974929.author: a TripAdvisor user
601974929.reviewBody: Beautiful place to visit in Centro Historico de Mexicali. It has been recently  renovated and it looks beautiful, a must visit if you are in Mexicali. Specially if you want to enjoy mass in spanish.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Calle Morelos # 192

590904574.name: Very Nice Small Cathedral
590904574.author: a TripAdvisor user
590904574.reviewBody: If you are traveling to Mexicali just to see this church, you may think otherwise as the rest of the area is pretty rundown and dreadful. Plus getting back to the USA will take 60 or more minutes.\nHowever, if you are there, the church is well kept and really nice and worth a stop.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Calle Morelos # 192

501681740.name: Downtown icon
501681740.author: a TripAdvisor user
501681740.reviewBody: Mexicali\'s Downtown Icon located in the heart of the city. Facilities need some maintenance. Next door you will find a bookstore where you can buy catholic cards, images, books and supplies for the churches.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Calle Morelos # 192

467090621.name: beautiful after a much needed remodelation
467090621.author: a TripAdvisor user
467090621.reviewBody: Been here recently and I was surprised with the new look of the Cathedral. It is beautiful, the only thing missing here is parking near this venue

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Calle Morelos # 192

458529163.name: Scenic cathedral
458529163.author: a TripAdvisor user
458529163.reviewBody: Lot\'s of work going on in and around the Cathedral. It looks like they are trying to re-energize this older part of Mexicali. Worth a visit.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Calle Morelos # 192

429728845.name: THE BEST MEXICAN TRADITION
429728845.author: a TripAdvisor user
429728845.reviewBody: I have been visit this place since 1964 when I took my first corpus Christi sacrament, I know all the corners of this sanctuary of our lady of Guadalupe and I ring the bells for many years in the higher of it\'s tower, the temple was build in 1918 then in 1966 became in Cathedral for this reason in October 2016 it celebrate the 50 anniversary, is located in the old town (traditional) of Mexicali, If you want to visit this place you have to come on December 12 because is Guadalupe\'s day (it\'s like a thanksgiving day) so many people makes pilgrimages carrying gifts and folklore.

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Calle Morelos # 192

337698697.name: Catedral de la virgen de guadalupe
337698697.author: a TripAdvisor user
337698697.reviewBody: If you are in tijuana im december you better stop at the cathedral to see how m xicans celebrate xmas is just wonderful!!!

itemReviewed.name: Catedral de Nuestra Senora de Guadalupe

address.streetAddress: Calle Morelos # 192

633112336.name: If You Are In Mexicali and You Like Craft Beer, This Is The Place For You!
633112336.author: a TripAdvisor user
633112336.reviewBody: They have really, really good beer, enthusiastic and knowledgeable staff (the ones we dealt with all speak good English) and they make good pizzas too! What more could you want?

address.streetAddress: Calle D #126

640754195.name: Los ni\u00f1os se la pasan muy bien.
640754195.author: a TripAdvisor user
640754195.reviewBody: A nosotros nos encanta llevar a nuestro hijo peque\u00f1o cada 6 meses, ya que, se la pasa fant\u00e1stico aunque nosotros nos asoleamos mucho. Tiene espacio para correr, jugar, ver los patos que andan libres. Hay lugares para comprar, pero es muy caro. El \u00e1rea de zool\u00f3gico es peque\u00f1a, no tienen muchos animales y los tienen en jaulas muy chicas, pero a los ni\u00f1os les gusta y les impresiona verlos tan de cerca. Tiene una zona donde hay animales de granja y tienen oportunidad de darles de comer (ah\u00ed venden a 10 pesos el botecito de comida). Al fondo est\u00e1n los animales con \u00e1reas m\u00e1s extensas, pero igual son pocos. Tienen un trenecito que hace recorrido alrededor del Bosque, pero tiene costo por persona aparte del boleto de entrada y los ni\u00f1os pagan de 3 a\u00f1os en adelante. Hay palapas para fiestas, son bastante accesibles y seg\u00fan la fecha, no requieren apartarse con mucha anticipaci\u00f3n.

itemReviewed.name: Bosque de la Ciudad de Mexicali

address.streetAddress: Calle Alvarado s/n Nueva Esperanza

342356388.name: GEOTERMICA IN MEXICALI
342356388.author: a TripAdvisor user
342356388.reviewBody: THE GEOTERMICA PLANT IN MEXICALI is and electrical source of energy IT WILL BE INTEREST for the people involved in energy company\'s. but not for the regular  TOURISM. IS one HOUR OUT OF MEXICALI, supply most of the energy for the state an BAJA CALIFORNIA, and is connected to usa, when Evert is need it they supply usa, or vice versa, . FOR THE PEOPLE valley of Mexicali is very HARMOUS. THEY  SOFERT FROM RESPIRATION AND SKIN PROBLEMS, BECAUSE OF THE CONTAMINATION.

address.streetAddress: Valle de Mexicali

631246547.name: desayuno delicioso
631246547.author: a TripAdvisor user
631246547.reviewBody: he visitado este lugar para desayunar y comer, tienen rica comida, buen ambiente, y limpio precios accesibles

address.streetAddress: Blvrd. Lazaro Cardenas

636347826.name: LUGAR OBLIGADO A VISITAR...
636347826.author: a TripAdvisor user
636347826.reviewBody: Excelentes exposiciones, que aportan elementos  importantes acerca de la cultura y tradiciones de nuestro estado,  es una visita necesaria para aquellas personas que desean enriquecer su conocimiento en historia de  nuestra ciudad.. gracias.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

594668573.name: De visita familiar
594668573.author: a TripAdvisor user
594668573.reviewBody: Es uno de los pocos lugares en Mexicali que no dejan de sorprender. Las exposiciones aportan elementos importantes acerca de la cultura y tradiciones de la regi\u00f3n. Es una visita recomendable.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

588642894.name: EL MEJOR MUSEO EN MEXICALI
588642894.author: a TripAdvisor user
588642894.reviewBody: Este Museo a cargo de la Universidad Aut\u00f3noma de Baja California mantiene exposiciones sumamente importantes sobre el Estado de Baja California.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

547018258.name: VISITA OBLIGADA PARA RESIDENTES Y FOR\u00c1NEOS
547018258.author: a TripAdvisor user
547018258.reviewBody: Es un espacio que deber\u00eda estar mejor aprovechado. No abundan los espacios culturales, y creo que cada vez aumenta la oferta y demanda de las Bellas Artes. Falta promoci\u00f3n y ofertas continuas y que sean de inter\u00e9s para grupos de todas las edades.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

483997153.name: muy buenas exposiciones
483997153.author: a TripAdvisor user
483997153.reviewBody: pero de berian tener mas exposiciones, mas seguido y tan buena como la del maiz esa fue una gran expo

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

448408060.name: MUSEO UNIVERSITARIO, INTERESANTE Y DIN\u00c1MICO
448408060.author: a TripAdvisor user
448408060.reviewBody: Desde su creaci\u00f3n el Museo Universitario se ha distinguido por su dinamismo en cuanto a las muestras que presenta, su museograf\u00eda es excelente y los gu\u00edas son especialistas en las muestras que atienden.\nCuentan con una Sala permanente sobre el estado de Baja California, que es muy recomendable para los estudiantes desde nivel b\u00e1sico y para la poblaci\u00f3n en general  resulta muy interesante enterarse de la riqueza mineral que tiene el estado sobre sus grupos \u00e9tnicos, gastronom\u00eda, costumbres, etc.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

448122363.name: Cultura en la ciudad
448122363.author: a TripAdvisor user
448122363.reviewBody: Me gustaron las exposiciones que alcance a ver en mi estadia, es uno de los pocos lugares que ofrecen este tipo de exposiciones en la ciudad.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

437659640.name: Vale la pena visitarlo.
437659640.author: a TripAdvisor user
437659640.reviewBody: Fui con mi familia a visitarlo durante la \u00faltima exposici\u00f3n y nos parec\u00edo interesant\u00edsima. Adem\u00e1s tiene un par de exposiciones permanentes que si bien podr\u00edamos encontrar mejores en otros luugares del mundo, esta est\u00e1 lo suficientemente buena y explicada. Tienen \u00e1rea para ni\u00f1os con biblioteca y eso tambi\u00e9n me gust\u00f3. Otro dato importante es que no tiene un costo elevado, cuando fui nos cobraron 15 pesos por persona... ;)

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

367465130.name: Una joya de la historia de la Regi\u00f3n
367465130.author: a TripAdvisor user
367465130.reviewBody: Muy poca gente lo conoce, es una Joya de la historia de la ciudad y la regi\u00f3n, hacen eventos muy especiales para los ni\u00f1os y no tan ni\u00f1os (detectives en pijamas) (paleont\u00f3logos en acci\u00f3n)

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

335701246.name: MUSEO
335701246.author: a TripAdvisor user
335701246.reviewBody: Esta bien para distraer a los ni\u00f1os y para algunos adultos pero en realidad no hay mucho que ver, con unas dos horas disponibles puedes ver todo bien!

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

332499729.name: \u00a1Muy interesante!
332499729.author: a TripAdvisor user
332499729.reviewBody: Yo fui cuando estaba estudiando y el guia nos mantuvo atentos a la exposicion, en aquella ocasion fue sobre las miles de personas desaparecidas en el pais. Si volveria a ir.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva

306115176.name: EXCLENTES EXPOSICIONES, CONFERENCIAS.
306115176.author: a TripAdvisor user
306115176.reviewBody: El Insituto y Museo de la UABC, es un sitio emblem\u00e1tico de la ciudad de Mexicali. Las exposiciones temporales que montan son excelentes, su sala permanente sobre la historia de la ciudad es magn\u00edfica. Cuenta con gu\u00edas-\nSe realizan conferencias, presentaciones de libros.

itemReviewed.name: Instituto de Investigaciones Culturales - Museo UABC

address.streetAddress: Calle L y Reforma Colonia Nueva
